frameDefinitions: A Cognizer makes a judgment about an Evaluee.

Some Possessor, either a nation, institution, or private individual, controls a Force whose primary functions to defend the Possessor (or, in the case of an institution or individual, some area of land significant to them) and to carry out offensive actions for the Possessor.
In this frame, a Resource_controller is judged by a Judge (who is usually implicit)  according to how freely they allow the Recipient access to their Resource.
The Agent is assigned to a Post where he or she performs a task associated with that Post.
A Speaker mentions a Specified_entity filling a Role, thereby providing information which supports a point of the Speaker.
An Employer employs an Employee whose Position entails that the Employee perform certain Tasks in exchange for Compensation.
frameExamples: JUDGMENT:  She <t>admired</t> Einstein for his character.
He cites the chief original observations <t>adduced</t> by Darwin as evidence for his theory.
I <t>employed</t> him as Chief Gardener for ten years.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Cognizer</fen> makes the judgment. This role is typically expressed as the External Argument (or in a <ment>by</ment>-PP in passives).
Evaluee is the person or thing about whom/which a judgment is made. With verbs this role is typically expressed as Object:
Typically, there is a constituent expressing the <t>Reason</t> for the Judge's judgment. It is usually a <ment>for</ment>-PP, e.g.
<fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part that conveys the judgment made by the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
The <fen>Force</fen> is the body of soldiers that acts in military capacity for the <fen>Possessor</fen>. This role is incorporated in each word in this frame.
The <fen>Possessor</fen> is the nation, institution, or individual who possesses and/or controls the <fen>Force</fen>.
The Resource_Controller is the individual who controls access to the Resource.
The Resource_controller controls the Recipient's access to the Resource.
The <fen>Recipient</fen> is the individual or individuals who receive or should receive the <fen>Resource</fen> from the <fen>Resource_controller</fen>.
The Behavior is an action of the Resource_controller which is judged to be generous or stingy.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part which indicates the character of the <fen>Resource_controller</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is assigned to a <fen>Post</fen> to perform a task involving a <fen>Salient_entity</fen>.
The <fen>Post</fen> is a location or station assigned to the <fen>Agent</fen> where a task or tasks are to be performed.
The <fen>Salient_entity</fen> is centrally involved in the task the <fen>Agent</fen> is assigned to perform. It is normally located at the <fen>Post</fen>.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> works at the <fen>Post</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Agent</fen> staffs the <fen>Post</fen>.
The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the person who specifies the <fen>Role</fen> to be filled by the <fen>Specified_entity</fen>.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the statement.
The entity that the <fen>Speaker</fen> identifies as filling a particular <fen>Role</fen>.
A slot in a particular or generic event or relation whose filler the <fen>Speaker</fen> identifies.
The time when the statement is made.
The role specifies the place where the statement takes place.
The role <fen>Employee</fen> denotes the person who is obligated to perform some <fen>Task</fen> in order to receive <fen>Compensation</fen>.
The <fen>Employer</fen> is the person (or institution) that gives <fen>Compensation</fen> to an <fen>Employee</fen>.
The role <fen>Field</fen> identifies the field in which the <fen>Employee</fen> is employed.
The role <fen>Position</fen> indicates a particular type of employment.
The <fen>Task</fen> indicates the action/duty that the <fen>Employee</fen> is obligated to do for the <fen>Employer</fen>.
The role <fen>Time</fen> identifies the time at whcih the <fen>Employer</fen> hires the <fen>Employee</fen>.
The role <fen>Place</fen> identifies the location where the <fen>Employer</fen> hires the <fen>Employee</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The boss</fex> appreciates you for your diligence.
The boss appreciates <fex>you</fex> for your diligence.
I admire you <fex>for your intellect</fex>.
She viewed him with an appreciative <fex>gaze</fex>.
The American invasion, which drew 26000 American troops against <fex>General Noriega's</fex> army, was the largest US military operation since Vietnam.
<fex>Stampy</fex> was stingy with his peanuts.
Surprising, Dad was stingy <fex>with his inheritance</fex>.
Mr. Burns is extremely miserly <fex>towards his employees</fex>.
It was generous of Jim <fex>to have us over for dinner</fex>.
Sue was staffing <fex>the entrance</fex> when everything started to go wrong.
You'll be working <fex>the phones</fex>.
Police manned the border <fex>from 3 to 5pm</fex>.
Working the front desk <fex>at a real estate office</fex> is not as fulfilling as it might seem.
But<fex>Arturo Boncato Jr., marketing manager of the Marco Polo Hotel,</fex> cited the high occupancy rates in the hotels as proof of increasing visitors' confidence.
<fex>In a subsequent paper</fex> he adduced further evidence.

Reilly pointed <fex>to the high labor costs</fex> as the
main reason for the decision to close down the New Orleans facility.
TCI named the overly expensive bid price <fex>as the main reason for their strict opposition against a merger</fex>.

Persistent, heavy rainfall and poorly maintained drainage systems were cited
<fex>yesterday</fex> as the prime causes for the rising floodwaters
<fex>In Kuala Lumpur</fex>, he also pointed to the accountability/assessment arena as a place for new businesses to investigate.
<fex>I</fex> was employed by an international corporation.
<fex>I</fex> employed him as Chief Gardener for ten years.
He was employed<fex>in finance</fex> fourteen years ago.
I'm not employed <fex>as your waitress</fex>!
I am employed <fex>to collect the trash</fex>.
Charles has been an employee of Microsoft <fex>since 1998</fex>!
Actually, he employed me <fex> at the downtown office </fex>.
